meanings.definition: Relating to a particular version or form.
meanings.sent1: The versional design of the website was sleek and modern.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the versional cover of the book with the colorful illustrations.
meanings.sent3: The versional color of the car made it stand out in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: His versional approach to problem-solving always yielded creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The versional logo of the company was instantly recognizable.

meanings.definition: A particular form or variant of something.
meanings.sent1: The software developer created a new versional of the app with enhanced features.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an ancient versional of the artifact in a glass case.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimented with a versional of the traditional recipe using unique ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His collection included a rare versional of the coin minted in limited quantities.
meanings.sent5: The artist's latest painting was a stunning versional of her previous work.
